Hour 1: Introduction to Trees: Terminology, Types of Binary trees; Non recursive Preorder, in-order and post-order traversal
Hour 2: Creation of binary trees from the traversal of binary trees
Hour 3: Binary search tree: Traversal, searching, insertion and deletion in binary search tree
Hour 4: Threaded Binary Tree: Finding in-order successor and predecessor of a node in threaded tree
Hour 5: Insertion and deletion in threaded binary tree; AVL Tree: Searching and traversing in AVL trees
Hour 6: Tree Rotations: Right Rotation, Left Rotation; Insertion and Deletion in an AVL Tree
Hour 7: B-tree: Searching, Insertion, Deletion from leaf node and non- leaf node
Hour 1: Introduction to Graphs: Undirected Graph, Directed Graph, graph terminology, Connectivity in Undirected and Directed Graphs
Hour 2: Spanning tree
Hour 3: Representation of graph: adjacency matrix, adjacency list, Transitive closure of a directed graph and path matrix
Hour 4: Traversals: Breadth First Search, Depth First Search; Self-learning Topics:  Implementation of BFS, DFS
Hour 5: Review and practice
Hour 1: Recursion: Writing a recursive function, Flow of control in recursive functions, Winding and unwinding phase, Recursive data structures, Implementation of recursion
Hour 2: Tail recursion; Indirect and Direct Recursion
Hour 3: Storage Management: Sequential Fit Methods: First Fit, Best Fit and Worst Fit methods
Hour 4: Fragmentation, Freeing Memory, Boundary Tag Method; Buddy Systems: Binary Buddy System, Fibonacci Buddy System
Hour 5: Compaction, Garbage Collection; Self-learning Topics: Implementation of recursion function
Hour 6: Review and practice
Hour 1: Searching: Sequential Search, Binary Search; Hashing:  Hash Functions: Truncation, Mid-square Method, Folding Method, Division Method
Hour 2: Collision Resolution: Open Addressing: Linear Probing, Quadratic Probing, Double Hashing, Separate Chaining Bucket Hashing

Hour 3: Analysis of all searching techniques
Sorting: Insertion sort, Selection sort, Merge sort, Quick sort and Radix sort

Hour 4: Analysis of all sorting techniques
Self-learning Topics: Implementation of different sorting techniques and searching
Hour 5: Review and practice
Hour 1: Applications of Linked Lists: Addition of 2 Polynomials and Multiplication of 2 polynomials

Hour 2: Applications of Stacks: Reversal of a String, Checking validity of an expression containing nested parenthesis, Function calls, Polish Notation: Introduction to infix, prefix and postfix expressions and their evaluation and conversions

Hour 4: Applications of Graphs: Dijkstra’s Algorithm, Minimum Spanning Tree: Prim’s Algorithm, Kruskal’s Algorithm
